worklogs.comment:
chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965
 
 
   Fixes bug where FlatBuffer serialization of TimestampType was not serializing the time zone, resulting in the time zone not being preserved. Existing round-trip serialization tests did not catch this bug, because they were both not including a timestamp field in the test record batches, and did not include tests for comparing array types.
   
   The test code was refactored to lift an abstraction from buffers to arrays; this both simplifies the code (we can use the fluent builder API) and offers more flexibility for comparing parametric array types like binary, string, timestamp, date/time, etc.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

eerhardt commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r355715543
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   One issue here is that `TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById` behaves differently on Unix vs. Windows. See [https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/2538](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/2538).
   
   Maybe we just expose `string Timezone` and callers can do what they want with it (like use [NodaTime](https://nodatime.org/) or something else).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

eerhardt commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r355718062
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   The C++ docs say:
   
   > If supplied, the timezone string should take either the form (i) “Area/Location”, with values drawn from the names in the IANA Time Zone Database (such as “Europe/Zurich”); or (ii) “(+|-)HH:MM” indicating an absolute offset from GMT (such as “-08:00”). To indicate a native UTC timestamp, one of the strings “UTC”, “Etc/UTC” or “+00:00” should be used.
   
   Do we support the `(+|-)HH:MM` notation?
   
   See [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/cpp/api/datatype.html#_CPPv4N5arrow13TimestampTypeE](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/cpp/api/datatype.html#_CPPv4N5arrow13TimestampTypeE)
   
   ---
   In reply to: [355715543](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r355715543) [](ancestors = 355715543)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r356215477
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   Exposing just the Timezone string would be okay, although I am curious about how much input validation we should do. Do you think it would make sense to implement our own IANA Time Zone Database provider? (or find a suitable dependency)
   
   Considering that the CoreFX implementation of TimeZoneInfo is not necessarily consistent with the IANA format (and may not ever be, for compatibility reasons).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

eerhardt commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r356233161
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   IMO - this is where NodaTime fits it. Callers can use that to convert IANA time zone IDs (like `Europe/Zurich`) to offsets.
   
   However, I don't think the Arrow library should depend on NodaTime, since I assume a considerable amount of users aren't interested in TimeStamps. Or if they are, they always use offsets (`-08:00`) and won't need to look up the IDs.
   
   That's why I think the Arrow library provides the data, ex. just `string Timezone`, and callers can optionally opt into NodaTime (or something else) to do the time zone lookup.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r356377834
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   Do you have any thoughts on handling **TimestampArray#GetTimestamp**? At the moment the implementation attempts to parse the timezone information and then applies the relevant offset on calls to **GetTimestamp**, since the underlying timestamp is normalized to UTC.
   
   I see a few options:
   
   - Constructor argument for the desired time zone
   - Argument to **GetTimestamp** specifying the desired time zone (could override the constructor argument)
   - Provide an interface that the array implementation can query against to resolve an IANA timezone string to an appropriate **TimeZoneInfo** structure, and in the future provide optional auxiliary packages that implement the interface (e.g. **Apache.Arrow.NodaTime**).
   - Do nothing and always return UTC **DateTimeOffset**, and require caller to convert to the expected time zone (e.g. **ToLocalTime**, **OffsetTo**)
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r356377834
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   Do you have any thoughts on handling **TimestampArray#GetTimestamp**? At the moment the implementation attempts to parse the timezone information and then applies the relevant offset on calls to **GetTimestamp**, since the underlying timestamp is normalized to UTC.
   
   I see a few options:
   
   - Constructor argument for the desired time zone
   - Argument to **GetTimestamp** specifying the desired time zone (could override the constructor argument)
   - Provide an interface that the array implementation can query against to resolve an IANA timezone string to an appropriate **TimeZoneInfo** structure, and in the future provide optional auxiliary packages that implement the interface (e.g. **Apache.Arrow.NodaTime**).
   - Do nothing and always return UTC **DateTimeOffset**, and require caller to convert to the expected time zone (e.g. **ToLocalTime**, **OffsetTo**). This seems like the most sensible approach to me.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r358513403
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   @eerhardt I have made the following changes:
   
   1. When constructing a timestamp array, the **TimeZoneInfo** is converted to an ISO8601 offset string (for convenience)
   2. **TimestampArray#GetTimestamp** no longer attempts to apply an offset (the result is always UTC normalized)
   3. **TimestampArray#GetTimestampUnchecked** provides a path that does not perform a null check
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

chutchinson commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r358513403
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   @eerhardt I have made the following changes:
   
   1. When constructing a timestamp array, the **TimeZoneInfo** is converted to an ISO8601 offset string (for convenience)
   2. **TimestampArray#GetTimestamp** no longer attempts to apply an offset (the result is always UTC normalized)
   3. **TimestampArray#GetTimestampUnchecked** provides a path that does not perform a null check. I'm open to criticism on the name; I could understand somebody thinking this doesn't do a bounds check or doesn't perform overflow evaluation.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

eerhardt commented on pull request #5965: ARROW-7318: [C#] TimestampArray serialization failure
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5965#discussion_r359074927
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/TimestampType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -27,6 +29,15 @@ public sealed class TimestampType : FixedWidthType
         public TimeUnit Unit { get; }
         public string Timezone { get; }
 
+        public TimeZoneInfo GetTimeZoneInfo()
+        {
+            return !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Timezone)
+                ? TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById(Timezone)
 
 Review comment:
   This all sounds good to me.
   
   As for the name of `GetTimestampUnchecked`, I'd be fine with what you have. The only alternative I can think of would be `GetTimestampSkipNullCheck`. I'm not confident that name is better than what you have.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*TimestampArray* throws during deserialization from a record batch previously serialized with the library. This appears to be because the timezone is not serialized for *TimestampType* in the Flatbuffer serialization implementation.

This does not appear in the round-trip serialization tests because the *TimestampArray* field is omitted from the test data, along with other parametric types.
